marc:datafield.marc:subfield: With a new introd. by Stella Gibbons and illus. by Helen Sewell.
Printed at the Spiral Press for the members of the Limited Editions Club,
Limited ed. of 1500 copies, signed by the illustrator.
a BBC TV production in association with Australian Broadcasting Commission ; BBC Worldwide Americas, Inc. ; produced by Jonathan Powell ; dramatized by Fay Weldon ; directed by Cyril Coke.
Side A contains episodes 1-3 -- Side B contains episodes 4-5.
Based on the novel Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen.
Film editor, Chris Wimble ; music composed by Wilfred Josephs ; conducted by Marcus Dods ; film cameraman, Paul Wheeler ; film sound recorder, Malcolm Webberley.
Elizabeth Garvie, David Rintoul, Moray Watson, Priscilla Morgan, Sabina Franklyn, Natalie Ogle, Tessa Peake-Jones, Clare Higgins, Osmond Bulock, Marsha Fitzalan.
The story of the lively, precocious and very eligible Bennet girls captures all the nuances of 19th century life among the English gentry, a society obsessed with profitable marriage contracts.
DVD; NTSC; region 1; Dolby Digital; full screen (4:3) presentation.
Video recordings for the hearing impaired.
a Mammoth Screen production for ITV1 supported by the Screen Yorkshire Production Fund ; produced by, Kate McKerrell ; written by Guy Andrews ; directed by Dan Zeff.
Based on the novel "Pride and prejudice" by Jane Austen.

Special features: "Lost in Austen: behind the scenes:" featurette documenting the reinvention of Jane Austen's 'Pride and prejudice' and the making of the popular TV series (43 min.); cast & crew interviews; behind-the-scenes footage; trailer.
Composer, Christian Henson ; additional music, Simon Whiteside ;
Jemima Rooper, Alex Kingston, Elliot Cowan, Hugh Bonneville, Gemma Arterton, Lindsay Duncan.

Amanda Price gets propelled into the scheming 19th century world of Pride and Prejudice while the book's Elizabeth Bennet is hurled into hers. As the plot unfolds, Amanda triggers new romantic twists and turns as she tries to help the Bennet sisters nab husbands and even manages to captivate the tantalizing Mr. Darcy. But what about Elizabeth, and what will become of one of the world's greatest love stories?
Originally released as a television mini-series in:
DVD, region 2, aspect ratio: 16:9, Dolby Digital stereo., NTSC.
Video recordings for the hearing impaired.
Univ of Chicago Pr, Attn: John Kessler 11030 S Langley Ave, Chicago, IL, USA, 60628, (773)5681550
Out of the wreck I rise :

Addiction is easy to fall into and hard to escape. It destroys the lives of individuals, and has a devastating cost to society. Steinberg and Bader harness the power of literature, poetry, and creativity to illuminate what alcoholism and addiction are all about. Each chapter begins with advice and commentary followed by a wealth of quotes to inspire and heal. The result is a mosaic of observations and encouragement that draws on writers and artists spanning thousands of years.
The best of life: the good times sour --
I don't want to do that: the end of the party --
The direction you least trust: making the leap --
Wait, for now: the importance of time --
Upon breach of my late vows: relapse --
SELF-HELP / Substance Abuse & Addictions / Alcohol^SELF-HELP / Substance Abuse & Addictions / General^SELF-HELP / Twelve-Step Programs.
saero ssŭn Syeiksŭp'iŏ myŏngjaksŏn = Romeo and Juliet /
kŭl Williŏm Syeiksŭp'iŏ ; yŏkkŏ omgim Yi Chae-myŏng ; kŭrim Andŭrea P'ise.
새로 쓴 셰익스피어 명작선 = Romeo and Juliet /
글 윌리엄 셰익스피어 ; 엮어 옮김 이 재명 ; 그림 안드레아 피세.
Romio wa Chulliet = Romeo and Juliet -- Haemlit = Hamlet -- Han yŏrŭm pam ŭi kkum = The midsummer night's dream -- T'aep'ung = The tempest.
로미오 와 줄리엣 = Romeo and Juliet -- 햄릿 = Hamlet -- 한 여름 밤 의 꿈 = The midsummer night's dream -- 태풍 = The tempest.
